comment: Great professor. Online tests that she reviews before and after. 2 projects online that are great grade boosters and do all of the extra credit before tests
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I had her for my MBA class back in 1992 or thereabouts, can't remember the exact year. Since I was a Finance major, I had only one or two accounting courses and she was really good. She put us in groups to play Monopoly in class and record each transaction which helped in my understanding of debits and credits.
This woman is a saint. I had her for study abroad and she made learning the material on such a short time frame manageable. She genuinely cares about your grade and outcome.

She gives you plenty of opportunities for an A, alot of assignments but they give you alot of points total if you just do them, plenty of extra credit opportunities, and a very helpful study guide that is similar to the tests. Do your work and extra credit and do decent of the tests and quizzes you should get an A. Four function calculators only!

Her quizzes are more difficult than her exams but the homework won't help you study for them. You must do the extra problems in the back of the chapter. Her quizzes and tests are chalked full of problems that really can take up an entire page. But you only have 3 minutes or less to solve it. So you won't have the time to use scratch paper.
online is very tough.  only 3 mins per questions on test, which is very difficult when you have to work out long problems.  I wish there was a little more time given on test.

Class was tough for me. This was my second time taking this class. I took it the 1st time with a different prof. She was ok. It was a lot of work. Somehow I made an A so I cant complain. She can come off as rude and condescending sometimes though, so I avoided talking to her. Overall, not bad and not that good either.
Tough class, but very fair.  She will meet with you outside of class and go out of her way to work with you. I feel very well prepared after her class, but it was tough.

Took online through McGraw-Hill Connect.  Stay on top of all assignments and complete the extra credit (time consuming).  Tests are difficult and the extra points will easily balance out any slip you might encounter.  An A is very obtainable but stay ahead and study connect exercises and understand the book content well. Her videos are very useful!

She is very helpful and will work with you. Drawback is she makes you use a four function calculator which is archaic. She doesnt give formulas except a notecard for you to write on for the final. Her tests can be sort of difficult. She has a lot of assignments like homework and quizes every week due.

Professor is knowledgeable of the subject matter. She uses the book daily and goes over the exercises. She is available for questions. She cares about students and always relate to real world. Take her

This is an amazing professor. She is a GREAT teacher. She is clear and keeps the class involved. The book is used everyday, because she goes over examples to help you understand the material. Tests are hard, but if you go to class and do the homework you will get an A. Take this professor!!! Would take her again

She is a great prof and extremely helpful. Gives lots of practice/study questions. I'm not an accounting major but this class is easier than 2100. I got a B with not much effort. Take her, she's good!

This is a great professor. If you come to class, take notes, and do the hw you should do well. This is a pretty tough class but it is accounting. Prof Malgeri taught me A LOT and made me extremely prepared for the higher level courses. Receiving an A was not very difficult.

I took her online. Very simple. Homework and quizzes were due every Sunday. One Midterm and one Final. There were several bonus points and an extra credit assignment. I got C's on both the midterm and final but with the extra points, I got a B. Don't depend on the teacher to help you understand, this is a class where you need to teach yourself.

I agree with other posts, AVOID THIS CLASS.  Her tests and quizzes are very confusing based on homework.  Seems like she tries to make the class harder because it's "online".  Beware, not a great use of your tuition dollars.
I would avoid her online class.  Her tests and quizzes are not coordinated well and are very confusing based on material learned.  Seems like she makes the class harder because it's "online".

Please do not take her class online. She was nowhere to be found for help. She basically puts up powerpoints and makes you teach yourself. The quizes and tests are not anything from the homework. I STRUGGLED for a B. An intro class should not be this difficult but should help us learn and prepare for other accounting courses.

This is an absolutely terrible teacher.  She uses to much of the homework online but doesn't teach in a way that helps retain information.  Teaches from powerpoint and doesn't explain them well either.  Did allow a cheat sheet for the final.

I took her online class and this teacher was invisible. You'd better be prepared to do a lot of personal study an work non-stop with the textbook. She is not flexible at all so make sure the read the instructions twice. And don't expect her to answer some of your concerns in the discussion board.

Although the tests, quizzes, and homework didn't correlate very much, the professor graded way heavier on homework which was easy. The end of semester project was also easy. The online tests and quizzes were timed, but an extensive amount of time was given. Not a hard class at all.

I love Accounting but this is a challenging class. Make sure you read the book before doing the homework and quizzes. Study the quizzes before the exams. She even gave us a makeup exam because everyone failed the 2nd test.
tests are much harder than home work and quizzes. doesnt slow down if students are lost or need more time. unless you are good at accounting, i dont recommend her.

The class is very unorganized.Some students didn't have books until after the 1st exam b/c SHE didn't order enough. Teaches one way and throws curve balls on tests,which she makes for the entire dept. Homework seems like it is due online on random days.Doesn't give explanations on missed quiz questions.Doesn't explain material well at all!

Never take her online class. It's way too much busy work and she is impossible to please. The bookstore was late getting the textbooks in and she still made me take a test without being able to study at all. I hate her class and am struggling to teach myself everything. The group project is impossible to figure out too. Avoid her online!
Teaches material one way and asks questions on the quizzes and tests completely different.
I took Prof Malgeri for a study abroad trip to China. I feel she communicates her expectations clearly and grades fairly. Love the NYC accent.

I am taking her online course as we speak. Never teaches a thing. All power points and notes are from those who designed the book. Does not always clearly state what she wants with group projects and then docks points without full explanation. If you aren't into spending time figuring out things on your own or having lots of busy work, avoid her.
Took this class online and she was really helpful. There is a lot of work but use the text book as a guide for homework and quizzes and you should do fine.
way too much busy work for an online class. do your homework and participate in the discussions and that will cushion your grade should you slip on quizzes or exams.

very helpful, great teacher, knows her material and teaches really good, just go to classes and learn what she emphasizes, read the book and practice homework, she gives some easy extra points, but the class is not a breese have to put a bit of effort in it.
hard teacher but very fair.  Do your work and you will excel.  Door always open ,very helpful.
Clearly answers questions
No Comments
Will not help you out at all.  If you get a border line grade it will stay that way even if you attended every class.
If your willing work, Prof. Malgeri is for you.

Very knowledgeable teacher. . .do your homework and ask her lots of questions about it. . .She loves participation and hates silent, blank stares.  Also gives oppy for extra credit for current event papers.  Don't be late to class-you may miss a quiz.
I went to every grueling 8AM course and got a D. It totally ruined my GPA. The next semester I took ACCT 2200 and got a B. Granted, diff material but the prof DOES make a difference.

Those that rate her low should try going to class.  She shows you how to do everything and explains herslef until you get the concepts.  If you show up and do her assignments, you will not make less than an "A".
No Comments
No Comments
